A colleague of mine here has ported the Mozilla character-set detection
library (originally C++) to Java.  Would that code be useful in
Heritrix?  As I understand it, it's a fairly comprehensive library that,
given a buffer whose character set is unknown, determines the most
likely answer based on statistical analysis.   The original C++ code is
found at
http://lxr.mozilla.org/mozilla/source/extensions/universalchardet/src/
and the ported Java version is, err, well, a link is forthcoming once
the fellow navigates the complexities of actually distributing it from
the LC's web space, but if it's potentially useful let me know.
 
Regards,
Andy Boyko   aboy@...
Library of Congress
